title.narrative: Integral Attention Centre to the Displaced CAID

description.narrative: The Project starts from the overview to the post-conflict transition in the dream to change poverty in cities, by the construction of hope in the country, alleviate reception to victim population of forced displacement in neighborhoods and communities more vulnerable, by reconciled people and families in the fight for equality, mediation and nonviolence. The impact of forced displacement on families go beyond the uprooting and loss of property; the impossibility of continuing with the project life often conceived in rurality, physical and emotional injuries are damages that require specialized care. The Mencoldes experience - and the Project Integral Attention Centre to the Displaced - CAID, show that is necessary mobilizing fighting strategies, grief and resilience management; enabling victims of displacement generate life skills.

This project will seek to provide families with reconciliation processes, memory exercises; building citizenships processes, comprehensive psychosocial care; hand on with the economic stabilization and rebuilding dreams, in a responsible exercise of action without damage.A feature of the strategy to strengthen and economic self-sustainability of families in places of arrival is in the personal accompaniment that will uncover the sustainability of citizen integration
